exercises.instruction: Complete with **each** or **every**.

items.prompt: 1) I get up at ____ daybreak in summer.
2) ____ child in the class has a desk.
3) We have a team meeting ____ Monday.
4) She wore a different dress ____ day of the week.
5) The bus stops at ____ stop on this route.
6) I spoke to ____ member of the group separately.
7) There is a fire drill ____ month.
8) ____ answer needs to be checked carefully.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **each (of)** / **every** / **every one of**.

items.prompt: 1) ____ my parents has their own car.
2) I’ve read ____ one of her books.
3) ____ these photos was taken in Spain.
4) ____ one of the students passed the test.
5) I wrote to ____ them, but nobody replied.
6) ____ seat in the theatre was full.
7) She speaks to ____ one of her neighbours.
8) I gave ____ of the children a sticker.
9) ____ room has a window.
10) I checked ____ of the answers twice.
11) He thanked ____ one of us.
12) ____ of these ideas could work.

exercises.instruction: Put **each** in the correct place (often at the end). Write the missing word.

items.prompt: 1) The sandwiches are €4 ____.
2) We were given two tickets ____.
3) The kids got a small present ____.
4) These batteries cost £3.50 ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **everyone** or **every one**.

items.prompt: 1) I invited ____ in my office.
2) ____ of the chairs was broken.
3) ____ was laughing at the joke.
4) She checked ____ of the documents.
5) ____ knows where the station is.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **who**, **which**, or **that**.

items.prompt: 1) That’s the singer ____ won the contest.
2) Where’s the jacket ____ was on the chair?
3) I need a phone ____ has a good camera.
4) The woman ____ lives next door is a dentist.
5) Do you know anyone ____ can fix bikes?
6) This is the app ____ saves passwords.
7) I like films ____ make me think.
8) He’s the colleague ____ helped me most.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with **who** / **which** / **that**.

items.prompt: 1) I’m looking for someone ____ speaks Japanese.
2) This is the camera ____ I bought last week.
3) The book ____ is on the table is mine.
4) He’s the doctor ____ treated my knee.
5) I want a place ____ is quiet at night.

exercises.instruction: Replace the pronoun (he/she/it/they) with a relative pronoun. Write **who**, **which**, or **that**.

items.prompt: 1) I met a man. ____ is a pilot.
2) We watched a film. ____ was really funny.
3) She bought a dress. ____ cost a fortune.
4) I know a girl. ____ works in a bank.
5) He found a key. ____ opens this gate.
6) That’s the teacher. ____ helped me a lot.
7) I need a tool. ____ can cut plastic.
8) We stayed in a hotel. ____ had a pool.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **what**.

items.prompt: 1) I don’t know ____ he wants.
2) Tell me ____ happened.
3) ____ you said made me laugh.
4) I can’t remember ____ her name is.
5) ____ I need now is a holiday.
6) Do you understand ____ I’m trying to say?
7) She didn’t like ____ she saw.
8) I’ll show you ____ I mean.
9) ____ he did was unfair.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **who**, **which**, or **that**.

items.prompt: 1) The people ____ live upstairs are noisy.
2) I need something ____ works quickly.
3) The bus ____ goes to the airport stops here.
4) She’s the one ____ knows the answer.
5) It’s a device ____ measures temperature.
6) The dog ____ bit me was tiny.
7) The song ____ is playing now is my favourite.
8) He’s the friend ____ always tells the truth.
9) That’s the photo ____ shows our old house.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with **who/which/that** (in these examples it could be omitted, but write one option).

items.prompt: 1) The book ____ I bought yesterday is already torn.
2) The person ____ you spoke to is my manager.
3) This is the hotel ____ we stayed at.
4) The film ____ I told you about was great.
5) The shoes ____ I’m wearing are new.
6) That’s the guy ____ I met in Madrid.
7) The music ____ we listened to was loud.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct preposition (to / for / with / about / at / from / in).

items.prompt: 1) That’s the colleague I work ____.
2) The person I spoke ____ didn’t listen.
3) Is this the topic you were talking ____?
4) That’s the hotel we stayed ____ last year.
5) The city she comes ____ is far away.
6) This is the drawer I keep my keys ____.
7) The reason I applied ____ this job is simple.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **that**, **what**, or write **blank** if no word is needed.

items.prompt: 1) Everything ____ she told me was true.
2) I ate all ____ was left.
3) What he did isn’t ____ I expected.
4) I’ll do everything ____ I can to help.
5) I can’t believe ____ you said.
6) Something ____ annoys me is noisy neighbours.
7) All ____ I want is a good night’s sleep.
8) That’s not ____ I meant.
9) Everything ____ happened was my fault.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **whose**.

items.prompt: 1) I met a woman ____ brother works with you.
2) That’s the student ____ phone rang in the exam.
3) We stayed with a family ____ house is by the sea.
4) She’s the singer ____ voice you heard.
5) I know a guy ____ car was stolen.
6) They hired someone ____ experience was perfect.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **whom**, **who**, or write **blank** if no word is needed (informal).

items.prompt: 1) The man ____ I saw yesterday waved at me.
2) The woman ____ I spoke to was very kind.
3) The person to ____ I wrote never replied. (formal)
4) Who was the girl ____ you were talking about?

exercises.instruction: Complete with **where**.

items.prompt: 1) That’s the café ____ we first met.
2) Is this the desk ____ you sit?
3) We visited the village ____ my grandparents were born.
4) I can’t find the place ____ I parked.
5) This is the room ____ we keep the tools.
6) Do you know a shop ____ I can buy cables?
7) That’s the stadium ____ they play home games.
8) It’s the street ____ I grew up.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **when**, **why**, or **that**.

items.prompt: 1) I’ll never forget the day ____ we arrived.
2) That was the moment ____ I realised the truth.
3) Do you know the reason ____ he left early?
4) Tell me the reason ____ you called.
5) I remember the time ____ we had no internet.
6) This is the only time ____ I can meet you.
7) That was the year ____ I started teaching.

exercises.instruction: Write **defining** or **non-defining**.

items.prompt: 1) My sister who lives in Canada is visiting. (clause identifies which sister)
2) My sister, who lives in Canada, is visiting. (extra information)
3) The car that is parked outside belongs to Sam.
4) My car, which I bought last year, is already breaking down.
5) People who work night shifts often feel tired.
6) Paul, who I met at university, is a doctor now.
7) The book that you lent me is excellent.
8) This book, which you lent me, is excellent.
9) Students who arrive late must wait outside.
10) My colleague, who sits next to me, speaks Spanish.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **who** or **which** (non-defining; commas are implied). Do NOT use **that**.

items.prompt: 1) Lisa, ____ works with me, is on holiday.
2) My phone, ____ I bought yesterday, is already scratched.
3) Mr Brown, ____ lives upstairs, is very friendly.
4) This film, ____ was made in 1998, is still popular.
5) Sarah, ____ you met last week, is my cousin.
6) The meeting, ____ lasted two hours, was boring.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **which** (refers to the whole clause).

items.prompt: 1) He missed the train, ____ meant he was late.
2) I forgot my wallet, ____ was annoying.
3) She changed the plan, ____ surprised everyone.
4) They won the match, ____ made them very happy.
5) I spilled coffee on my laptop, ____ was a disaster.
6) He apologised, ____ I appreciated.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **whom** or **which** (formal: preposition + whom/which).

items.prompt: 1) Mr Davis, to ____ I spoke, was helpful.
2) The company, for ____ she works, is expanding.
3) The woman, with ____ I travelled, is from Spain.
4) The town, in ____ they live, is very small.
5) My friend, about ____ I told you, is arriving.
6) The project, on ____ we spent months, failed.
7) The professor, from ____ I learned a lot, retired.
8) The topic, on ____ we agreed, is important.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a phrase like **all of whom / most of which / none of which / one of whom**, etc.

items.prompt: 1) She has three sisters, ____ live abroad.
2) We visited five museums, ____ were free.
3) He gave me two reasons, ____ made sense.
4) Ten students came, ____ passed the exam.
5) I bought six apples, ____ were rotten.
6) They own four houses, ____ is in Italy.
7) We had a long meeting, ____ was useful.
8) She has many friends, ____ she trusts.
9) I read three articles, ____ were about AI.
10) Two men helped me, ____ I’d never met before.
11) He showed me several photos, ____ I had seen already.

exercises.instruction: Complete with **which** (refers to the whole idea).

items.prompt: 1) He changed his mind, ____ surprised me.
2) They cancelled at the last minute, ____ was annoying.
3) I lost my keys, ____ meant I couldn’t get in.
4) She arrived early, ____ was unusual.
5) He forgot my name, ____ was embarrassing.
6) We got a flat tyre, ____ delayed us.
7) The lift broke, ____ made everyone angry.
8) She spoke quietly, ____ I appreciated.

exercises.instruction: Write the **-ing** form.

items.prompt: 1) the woman ____ to Tom (talk)
2) the boy ____ across the road (run)
3) a dog ____ at the door (bark)
4) people ____ in the queue (wait)
5) a man ____ a suitcase (carry)
6) music ____ from next door (come)

exercises.instruction: Write the correct **past participle** (used in an -ed clause).

items.prompt: 1) the boy ____ in the accident (injure)
2) the window ____ by the wind (break)
3) the money ____ from my bag (steal)
4) the meal ____ yesterday (cook)
5) the letter ____ last week (send)
6) the car ____ outside the house (park)

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct **-ing** or **-ed** form.

items.prompt: 1) The man ____ at the window looked worried. (stand)
2) The bike ____ last week has been found. (steal)
3) I spoke to the woman ____ the reception desk. (run)
4) Most of the people ____ to the party didn’t know me. (invite)
5) The photos ____ on this page were taken in 2010. (show)
6) Anyone ____ too fast will get a ticket. (drive)
7) The files ____ yesterday are in this folder. (upload)
8) The child ____ in the corner is my nephew. (sit)
9) The report ____ by Sara was excellent. (write)
10) I saw smoke ____ from the engine. (rise)

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct **-ing** or **-ed** form.

items.prompt: 1) There were people ____ outside the shop. (wait)
2) There was a car ____ in my space. (park)
3) Is there anyone ____? (listen)
4) There were several windows ____ after the storm. (break)
5) There was a smell ____ from the kitchen. (come)
6) There were letters ____ on the floor. (scatter)
7) There was a baby ____ loudly. (cry)
8) There were bikes ____ against the wall. (lean)

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct adjective: **-ing** or **-ed**.

items.prompt: 1) The lesson was really ____ (bored/boring).
2) I was ____ during the flight. (bored/boring)
3) It’s an ____ idea. (excited/exciting)
4) She felt ____ about the trip. (excited/exciting)

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct form (**-ing** or **-ed**).

items.prompt: 1) The news was ____ . (shock)
2) They were ____ by the news. (shock)
3) I’m ____ in astronomy. (interest)
4) It’s an ____ book. (interest)
5) The job is really ____ . (tire)
6) I’m ____ after work. (tire)
7) That was a very ____ experience. (embarrass)
8) He felt ____ when he forgot her name. (embarrass)
9) The game was ____ . (excite)
10) The kids were ____ . (excite)
11) The instructions were ____ . (confuse)
12) I was ____ by the instructions. (confuse)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with an **-ing** or **-ed** adjective.

items.prompt: 1) I’m ____ because I have so much to do. (stress)
2) It’s a ____ situation. (stress)
3) We had a really ____ day at work. (exhaust)
4) I’m completely ____ . (exhaust)
5) The film was ____ . (depress)
6) She felt ____ after watching it. (depress)
7) This puzzle is ____ . (frustrate)
8) I get ____ when it doesn’t work. (frustrate)
9) The journey was ____ . (tire)
10) We were ____ when we arrived. (tire)
11) It was ____ to meet you. (delight)

exercises.instruction: Put the words in the correct order.

items.prompt: 1) (nice / old / house) → ____
2) (beautiful / large / garden) → ____
3) (lovely / little / café) → ____
4) (strange / new / rule) → ____
5) (small / round / wooden / table) → ____
6) (big / old / black / leather / bag) → ____
items.canonical: a big old black leather bag
accepted_variants: a big old black leather bag
A big old black leather bag
a big old black leather bag.
a big old black leather bag,
a big old black leather bag!
a big old black leather bag?

items.prompt: 7) (new / Italian / sports / car) → ____
8) (large / blue / plastic / box) → ____
9) (pretty / little / silver / ring) → ____
10) (ugly / brown / wool / coat) → ____
11) (amazing / modern / building) → ____
12) (old / French / song) → ____
13) (two / small / white / cups) → ____
14) (expensive / new / electric / bike) → ____
15) (long / black / silk / dress) → ____
16) (nice / warm / winter / jacket) → ____
17) (small / Japanese / restaurant) → ____
18) (beautiful / old / stone / bridge) → ____

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct phrase (write it).

items.prompt: 1) a round wooden table / a wooden round table
2) a black leather jacket / a leather black jacket
3) a nice new idea / a new nice idea
4) a small old house / an old small house
5) a beautiful long day / a long beautiful day
6) a modern Italian design / an Italian modern design

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct word (adjective or adverb).

items.prompt: 1) You look ____ today. (tired / tiredly)
2) She spoke very ____ . (polite / politely)
3) The soup tastes ____ . (good / well)
4) He drives ____ . (careful / carefully)
5) I feel ____ about it. (bad / badly)
6) They worked ____ all day. (hard / hardly)
7) He opened the box ____ . (easy / easily)
8) The music sounds ____ . (terrible / terribly)
9) She smiled ____ . (happy / happily)

exercises.instruction: Complete the phrase with **first/next/last** + number.

items.prompt: 1) We’ll be busy for the ____ two days.
2) I’ll call you again in the ____ ten minutes.
3) He read the ____ three chapters in one evening.
4) I won’t be free for the ____ few weeks.
5) In the ____ two lessons we’ll revise.
6) The ____ five people will get a prize.
7) I didn’t sleep well for the ____ two nights.
8) We’ll decide in the ____ couple of days.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct word form.

items.prompt: 1) He spoke ____ . (quiet)
2) She smiled ____ . (happy)
3) It was a ____ atmosphere. (friendly)
4) We had a ____ chat. (lovely)
5) The children played ____ . (noisy)
6) He answered ____ . (polite)

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct word.

items.prompt: 1) She’s a ____ driver. (good / well)
2) She drives ____ . (good / well)
3) The team played ____ . (bad / badly)
4) The weather is ____ today. (terrible / terribly)
5) He did ____ in the test. (good / well)
6) That was a ____ decision. (stupid / stupidly)
7) He reacted ____ . (stupid / stupidly)
8) It’s ____ to understand. (easy / easily)
9) I can ____ understand it. (easy / easily)
10) She’s ____ about exams. (nervous / nervously)
11) She spoke ____ . (nervous / nervously)
12) The train arrived ____ . (late / lately)

exercises.instruction: Complete with an adjective or adverb.

items.prompt: 1) You look ____ . (tired / tiredly)
2) He felt ____ after the run. (bad / badly)
3) The food tastes ____ . (good / well)
4) She sings ____ . (beautiful / beautifully)
5) The plan sounds ____ . (great / greatly)
6) He works ____ . (hard / hardly)
7) This suitcase feels ____ . (heavy / heavily)
8) She listened ____ . (careful / carefully)
9) The engine runs ____ . (smooth / smoothly)
10) I feel ____ about it. (happy / happily)

exercises.instruction: Complete with an adverb (e.g., really, extremely, terribly, badly).

items.prompt: 1) I’m ____ sorry about that.
2) She was ____ kind to me.
3) The car was ____ damaged.
4) He was ____ tired after the trip.
5) It’s ____ important to be on time.
6) The room was ____ organised.
7) I was ____ surprised to see him.
8) That’s ____ unfair.
9) She’s ____ good at maths.
